seller_description: Product Description: This Nabisco Team Favorites Snacks Variety Pack includes CHIPS AHOY! Mini, OREO Mini cookies, Teddy Grahams Honey and Barnum's Animal Crackers, to give you all your favorite flavors in convenient snack packs. These treats are bite-size versions of classic snacks, great for on-the-go nibbling or afternoon snacking. OREO Mini cookies bring a tiny twist to the chocolate sandwich cookies you already know, and CHIPS AHOY! Mini chocolate chip cookies deliver a classic chocolate chip flavor in an adorable bite-size snack. Barnum's Animal Crackers and Teddy Grahams Honey snack crackers provide just the right touch of sweetness to brighten your day. Grab this team-sized box next time you're on snack duty for a big game or tuck a bag of these individual snacks into a office or school lunchbox for an afternoon treat. This bulk box of on the go snacks includes 30 individual packages for convenient storage and easy packing. Product details: Is Discontinued By Manufacturer : No. Product Dimensions : 7.32 x 9 x 8.9 inches; 1.88 Pounds. Item model number : 10044000050389. UPC : 044000050382. Manufacturer : MONDELEZ INTERNATIONAL INC. ASIN : B06XKHNCZW. Country of Origin : Mexico
review: Purchased them on July 18th and they were outdated by 3 months
expected-output: Seller's Image and Description: The seller's image displays a box of Nabisco Team Favorites Snacks Variety Pack, containing 30 individually packaged snacks, including 8 packs of Oreo Minis, 8 packs of Chips Ahoy! Minis, 7 packs of Teddy Grahams Honey, and 7 packs of Barnum's Animal Crackers. The product description highlights that these snacks are great for on-the-go nibbling, lunchboxes, and convenient storage, and they are intended for a long shelf life. Buyer's Experience and Image: The buyer’s image shows an individual snack packet of Barnum's Animal Crackers with an expired "Best When Used By" date of April 9, 2024. The buyer stated that they purchased the product on July 18th, finding that the packs were already three months past the best-by date. This discrepancy raises concerns about freshness and the seller's storage practices. Discrepancy Assessment: There is a significant discrepancy here. While the seller's description implies that the product should be fresh and within a reasonable shelf life, the buyer received items that were already past the expiration date by three months. This could imply either an issue with inventory rotation on the seller’s end or a potential oversight during packaging. Buyer Satisfaction: The buyer is dissatisfied due to the expired snacks, which are not suitable for consumption, especially for children. They expected fresh items within the valid shelf life. Fault Assessment: The fault lies with the seller, as they provided expired items, which contradicts the expectation set by the seller’s description. This experience affects the buyer's trust in the seller's quality control and inventory management. Conclusion: The buyer’s negative experience stems from receiving expired snacks, which is a clear fault of the seller's inventory management. This incident highlights the need for better quality checks to ensure that all products meet the freshness standards expected by consumers." The seller is at fault due to a failure in inventory management, as expired snacks were provided, which contradicts the expectation of freshness implied by the seller's description. This oversight impacted the buyer's trust in the seller's quality control, resulting in justified dissatisfaction.
label: 0:Here seller is at fault
